business.headline: From OTPs, KYC to e-Sign: How everyday slips are fuelling a new wave of digital fraudFraudsters no longer hack systems, they hack human behaviour, using lookalike pages, cloned voices and urgent prompts. Even routine steps like OTPs, KYC and e-Sign are becoming easy entry points. Are consumers prepared for this new kind of digital deception?
HUL's Nitin Paranjape shares dramatic account of company's 5-lakh store leapNitin Paranjpe recalled proposing the addition of five lakh outlets, a number he admitted sounded unrealistic at first.

Why is Zerodha's Nithin Kamath warning investors against pre-IPO hype?With IPO buzz at its peak, Nithin Kamath has stepped in to warn investors about the increasing speculation in the unlisted market, where many buyers are chasing inflated pre-IPO valuations.

How do you recover money after credit card fraud? Steps you must knowRecovering money after credit card fraud can feel stressful, but the process is simpler if you act quickly. Knowing the right steps — and your rights, can greatly improve your chances of getting your money back.

India's GDP rises by 8.2% in Q2 despite Trump tariffs, highest in six quartersIndia's 8.2% Q2 GDP print has beaten forecasts despite pressure from US tariffs, with manufacturing and services driving momentum and reaffirming the nation's place as the fastest-growing major economy heading into FY26.

Sensex, Nifty end flat as Dalal Street takes breather after hitting all-time highsThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 13.71 points to close at 85,706.67, while the NSE Nifty50 ended 12.60 points lower at 26,202.95. The broader market also remained subdued, with most major sectoral indices finishing in the red.

Are millennials relying too heavily on SIPs for wealth building?Millennials swear by SIPs for long term investing, but are they mistaking convenience for safety? As market cycles turn unpredictable, is it time to rethink what "safe investing" really means?

From tax deadlines to LPG, pensions: 5 major financial changes starting December 1Before December begins, it's worth noting that several new financial rules will kick in, affecting your bills, savings and even travel plans. Whether it's cooking gas, pension rules or tax filings, here's what to expect as the calendar turns.

Sudeep Pharma shares rise nearly 29% over IPO price. What should investors do?Sudeep Pharma's strong debut has impressed investors, but with valuations now stretched, is this the right moment to book profits or should investors stay put and ride the long-term story?

From GMP to price band: 5 things to know about Meesho IPOThe SoftBank-backed e-commerce platform has set a price band of Rs 105 to Rs 111 per share, valuing the company at nearly Rs 50,100 crore at the upper end.

Will your pension stop after November 30? Check nowThe deadline to submit the annual Life Certificate is almost here, and missing it could put your pension on hold. Pensioners must complete the process by 30 November to avoid any interruption.

New labour codes bring major employee benefits, but what are the big challenges?The new labour codes promise stronger protection and wider benefits for workers, but the real test begins now as businesses brace for higher costs, major restructuring and a challenging transition across sectors.

Why is tax department sending SMS alerts to 25,000 taxpayers about foreign assets?Tax officials examined data received from foreign jurisdictions through the Automatic Exchange of Information (AEOI) system. This international framework allows countries to share details of financial accounts held abroad by their residents.

Meesho IPO opening on December 3: What investors need to knowMeesho IPO is all set to open for subscription, backed by strong GMP cues and rising investor interest, but can the value-commerce giant turn pre-listing hype into sustained market performance? Here is all you need to know.

Is your money lying unclaimed? Here's how Delhi's new campaign help you recover itThe move is part of the Centre's ongoing 'Apki Punji, Apka Adhikar' campaign, which focuses on returning such funds to their rightful owners.

Sudeep Pharma makes strong market debut. Hold or book profit now?A blockbuster debut has rewarded Sudeep Pharma IPO investors. Should you cash out while sentiment is high or hold on for the company's expansion and export growth story?

Sudeep Pharma shares list at 23% premium in strong market debutThe Rs 895-crore issue, which was subscribed an extraordinary 93.71 times between November 21 and 25, opened at Rs 730 on the NSE and Rs 725 on the BSE, against the upper-end IPO price of Rs 593.

GAIL share price tumbles 6%. Here's why the PSU stock is falling todayThe slump in GAIL's share price reflects investor disappointment over a tariff hike that landed far below expectations. With a full review pushed to 2028, the market is recalibrating its outlook on earnings support for the PSU major.
Sensex, Nifty take breather after hitting record highsThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 65.92 points at 85,786.30 around 9:22 am, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 16.65 points to 26,232.20.

entertainment.headline: Abhishek's emotional post for Ashnoor after her eviction: You became my calm Abhishek Bajaj visited Ashnoor Kaur's home after her eviction from 'Bigg Boss 19'. He shared images, a video and a heartfelt note about her performance and their friendship during the show.

Judi Dench says she can't recognise people anymore due to vision loss Celebrated British actor Judi Dench, 90, has opened up about her worsening vision. She revealed that age-related macular degeneration has left her unable to recognise even close friends and colleagues.

Swara Bhasker's father-in-law suffers brain haemorrhage, undergoes surgery Swara Bhasker revealed that her father-in-law suffered a brain haemorrhage and underwent surgery early this morning. In an Instagram post, the actor requested prayers and privacy as the family navigates this difficult period.

The Girlfriend on OTT: When and where to watch Rashmika Mandanna's film Rahul Ravindran's directorial 'The Girlfriend', starring Rashmika Mandanna and Dheekshith Shetty, is set for its OTT premiere. The film received positive reviews during its theatrical run in early November.

Sophie Choudry schools troll questioning her Bollywood career: Such a sad mentality Sophie Choudry shut down trolls questioning her career after she shared photos with Jennifer Lopez from a billionaire wedding she hosted in Udaipur. The singer-host clarified that she has built a successful career through live shows and events, reminding critics that visibility on screen isn't the only measure of success.

Sidharth Malhotra on his daughter Saraayah's name and what makes it exotic Sidharth Malhotra shared the meaning behind his daughter Saraayah's name at a recent event. He further reflected on parenthood and praised his actor-wife, Kiara Advani.

Jaya Bachchan slams paparazzi's conduct, credibility: Who are these people? Jaya Bachchan has voiced strong criticism of the paparazzi. She distinguished journalists from photographers at public events and questioned the latter's conduct and credibility.

Rapper Bohemia pays tribute to Sidhu Moose Wala at latest Dubai concert. Watch Bohemia's emotional on-stage tribute to Sidhu Moose Wala went viral, moving fans and highlighting the deep respect between the two Punjabi music icons. The moment reignited love for their iconic collaboration "Same Beef" and reminded listeners of Moose Wala's lasting legacy.

Veteran Kannada actor MS Umesh dies at 80 after long battle with cancer Kannada actor MS Umesh, known for his iconic comic roles and decades-long contribution to the film industry, died on Sunday at the age of 84.

Manisha Koirala flaunts grey-hair look, fans call her true beauty Manisha Koirala impressed fans with her natural, no-makeup, greying-hair look during a recent airport appearance, drawing praise for her confidence and authenticity.

5 times Ariana and Cynthia broke the net with bizarre, cringe and confusing antics Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo delivered tons of unforgettable, meme-worthy moments during the Wicked: For Good press tour, from emotional interviews to bizarre red-carpet antics.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9 Highlights: Vijay Sethupathi roasts and warns FJ Vijay Sethupathi confronted FJ on Bigg Boss Tamil 9 for faking an injury, neglecting his captaincy duties, and manipulating Parvathi, leaving the contestant in tears. The host also slammed the housemates for misunderstanding the school task and pushed them to reflect through an anonymous-letter challenge.

Ranveer Singh faces backlash for mimicking Kantara's Chaundi scene at IFFI. Watch Ranveer Singh sparked controversy after mimicking a scene from Kantara Chapter 1 and referring to Chaundi as a "female ghost" during his stage act at IFFI 2024. His impression, which left Rishab Shetty laughing, has triggered a wave of criticism online for being "disrespectful" and insensitive to Daiva traditions.

Priyanka Chopra shares Thanksgiving note, says she's back home for a quick minute Priyanka Chopra returned home briefly to celebrate Thanksgiving and shared a heartfelt note about gratitude, family, and simple joys, accompanied by intimate photos.

Nayanthara gets sweet birthday wishes from her twin sons: Best amma in the world Nayanthara celebrated her birthday by sharing unseen photos with her twin sons, Ulag and Uyir, who gifted her a handmade card calling her the "best amma in the world."

Sorry yaar: Anupam Kher says Naseeruddin Shah apologised for their heated 2020 rift Anupam Kher has shared that Naseeruddin Shah recently apologised to him, signalling a thaw in their long-standing and highly publicised feud. Despite past clashes and sharp public remarks, the actors appear to be moving toward a more cordial equation.

Tere Ishk Mein box office Day 2: Dhanush-Kriti's film crosses Rs 33 crore mark Tere Ishk Mein continues its steady run at the box office, collecting  Rs 17 crore on Day 2 and taking its total to Rs 33 crore in India. Despite mixed reviews, the Dhanush–Kriti Sanon starrer maintains strong occupancy across major cities.

Meet Kusum: Sayani Gupta on playing Delhi Crime 3's unpredictable chameleon Sayani Gupta shares her experience of playing the complex and unpredictable Kusum in Delhi Crime Season 3, highlighting the creative freedom and improvisation that shaped her role.

Cynthia Erivo, Ariana Grande in 'non-demi-curious-semi-binary' relationship? Viral posts alleging a unique relationship between Hollywood actors Cynthia Erivo and Ariana Grande have surfaced on social media. Here's everything you need to know about their 'non-demi-curious semi-binary relationship' label.

general news.headline: 10 dead, 40 injured in head-on collision between two buses in Tamil NaduThe injured were taken to Sivagangai Government Hospital, and police have launched an investigation into the cause of the crash.

1st ODI Live: Harshit removes Brevis to dent South Africa's fightbackIndia (IND) vs South Africa (SA) 1st ODI Live Score and Updates: Harshit Rana has now picked up three wickets, the latest being the massive scalp of Dewald Brevis. South Africa had reasons to hope with Brevis in full attack mode, but with him gone, it's up to Marco Jansen to keep the charge going with Breetzke.

SIR extended by 7 days in all states, draft electoral list to be out on December 16The Election Commission of India has extended the Special Intensive Revision schedule by a week in 12 States and Union Territories to ensure voters can verify their names in the electoral rolls. This move aims to enhance the accuracy and inclusiveness of voter lists ahead of upcoming elections.

Virat Kohli or Sachin Tendulkar: Gavaskar picks his greatest ODI batterSunil Gavaskar hailed Virat Kohli as the greatest ODI batter after his 52nd hundred in Ranchi, saying even Ricky Ponting calls him the best he has seen and that surpassing Sachin Tendulkar leaves Kohli at the very top.

Who stole the colours of India?Ancient India was among the first to experiment with colours and dyed fabric was part of its prime exports. However, the west's fear of colours, India's colonial history and mindset, and the class bias associated with bright palettes are making India go colourless. Indians are taking to pastels, monochromes and neutral colours, for clothes, cars and buildings. Will Indians embrace their very own colours and make the dull world colourful?

Why Lord Ram's tallest statue has come up in party-paradise GoaIn Goa, where the magnet is sun, sand, and nightlife, a 77-foot bronze statue of Lord Ram was unveiled by PM Narendra Modi. It might seem unusual to many, but Lord Ram's statue in Goa is rooted in centuries of Dvaita Vaishnavism and the 550-year legacy of the Partagali Math. The statue is a symbol of faith and cultural resilience, as underlined by the PM.

Coimbatore man kills wife, posts selfie with body calling it 'payment for betrayal'A man in Coimbatore allegedly killed his wife after suspecting her of an affair and then posted a chilling selfie with her body. Police arrested the accused, Balamurugan, soon after the incident and have begun an investigation.

Bhopal man claims girlfriend's family forced him to convert, eat beef; FIR filedThe man named Shubham Goswami told police that his girlfriend's family forcefully converted him to Islam by feeding him beef and making him offer prayers.

Rohit Sharma's expletive-laden celebration of Virat Kohli's century goes viralIndia vs South Africa: Former India captain Rohit Sharma's raw and unfiltered reaction to Virat Kohli's record-extending 52nd century during the first ODI against South Africa in Ranchi went viral.

Madhya Pradesh CM's son marries alongside 21 couples at Ujjain mass wedding eventThe CM's family opted for a modest celebration, with a simple invitation card, traditional processions and no lavish displays. The event, designed to promote simplicity and social harmony, saw 21 other couples also tying the knot.

Trump's Peace Plan Meets Kyiv's Political Chaos — and Putin's LeverageAndriy Yermak, Volodymyr Zelenskyy's Chief of Staff, was forced to resign following a police raid on his home linked to a widening corruption scandal. A key figure in war-end negotiations with Russia, his exit jeopardises the talks.

Centre holds all-party meet ahead of Parliament Winter Session, 14 bills on cardsThe government on Sunday met floor leaders of parties ahead of Parliament's Winter session, which is set to commence on Monday.

Jagadish Chandra Bose built a radio before Marconi, but never took creditJagadish Chandra Bose pioneered early radio-wave detection and plant physiology, yet refused to patent his work, believing knowledge should be kept open for all. His science blended curiosity, ethics and invention, shaping wireless communication and plant research long before the world noticed. And he was the OG science fiction writer in Bengali too.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Israeli PM Netanyahu requests presidential pardon in long-running corruption casesHis request will be reviewed by the justice ministry before being forwarded to the Legal Advisor in the President's Office, which will prepare additional opinions to guide the president's decision.

Cyclone Ditwah intensifies near Tamil Nadu coast, rain batters southern India Live UpdatesExtremely heavy rain continues across many parts of Tamil Nadu as cyclonic storm Ditwah, which earlier devastated Sri Lanka, is getting closer to Tamil Nadu-Puducherry coast.

Why rare Earth elements are the new strategic fuel for IndiaSeventeen metals power everything from silent EVs to roaring missiles. India is turning its beach sand into strategic gold before it's too late.

Delhi civic bypolls record 31.13% turnout till 4 pm amid high-stakes contestVoting is underway across 12 MCD wards in Delhi, marking a crucial political test after BJP's assembly win earlier this year. The election sees strong security measures and appeals from top leaders to boost voter turnout.

Politics trumps economics: S Jaishankar's veiled dig at US amid trade tensionsS Jaishankar's comments come against the backdrop of recent trade disputes and steep US tariffs, including a 50 per cent rate on Indian imports levied by US President Donald Trump.

No WhatsApp without active SIM: India mulls 6-hour logouts to curb misuseThe Indian government mandates WhatsApp accounts to remain linked to active SIM cards to enhance cybersecurity. This move aims to reduce online fraud but faces criticism over its effectiveness and user convenience.

sports.headline: Treesa-Gayatri defend women's doubles crown, Srikanth suffers heartbreak India wrapped up the Syed Modi International Super 300 with mixed fortunes on Sunday, as Treesa Jolly and Gayatri Gopichand stylishly defended their women's doubles crown, while Kidambi Srikanth's long title drought extended after a heartbreaking three-game defeat in the men's singles final.

Rohit Sharma's expletive-laden celebration of Virat Kohli's century goes viral India vs South Africa: Former India captain Rohit Sharma's raw and unfiltered reaction to Virat Kohli's record-extending 52nd century during the first ODI against South Africa in Ranchi went viral.

Special Report: Indian Batters Smash Records in ODI Match Against South Africa This special report provides coverage of an ODI cricket match between India and South Africa. The broadcast highlights a significant century scored by a top-order Indian batter, marking a major milestone in his career. It also details a record-breaking performance by the team captain, who surpassed a long-standing record for the most sixes in the format. The segment describes a 136-run partnership between the two senior players and notes the dismissal of one batter by a South African pacer. The report concludes with an update on the match situation as the centurion continues his innings.

Rohit Sharma Breaks Shahid Afridi's All-Time Record for Most ODI Sixes in Ranchi On this Special Report, the focus is on the 1st ODI between India and South Africa in Ranchi. Rohit Sharma has created history by breaking Shahid Afridi's long-standing record for the most sixes in ODI cricket. The 'Hitman' achieved this feat while batting alongside Virat Kohli, with the duo—dubbed 'Roko'—looking to dominate. Stand-in captain KL Rahul leads the side in the absence of injured regulars. South Africa won the toss and opted to bowl first in this crucial series opener.

Virat Kohli fan evades security, falls at his feet interrupting hundred celebration Virat Kohli scored his 52nd ODI century during the first match against South Africa in Ranchi. A pitch invader interrupted his century celebration by falling at his feet.

Virat Kohli coming for 2027 World Cup: Ranchi hundred leaves fans in awe Virat Kohli's 52nd ODI hundred in Ranchi sparked a massive reaction from former cricketers and fans, with many already backing him for the 2027 ODI World Cup after a composed, vintage knock that showcased his hunger and dominance.

IND vs SA: Vintage Virat Kohli continues Ranchi love affair, hits 52nd ODI hundred Virat Kohli pulled off an absolute classic in the ODI series opener against South Africa, smashing his 52nd ODI hundred. He extends his stellar record in Ranchi as he helped India put up a formidable first-innings total.

Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma to come out of Test retirement? Pietersen reacts to rumours Kevin Pietersen has called on the BCCI to seriously consider Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli returning to Test cricket. Their comeback is seen as crucial for the survival of Test cricket in India after recent series losses.

Shah Rukh Khan pays Andre Russell tribute, explains new KKR Power Coach roleKKR owner Shah Rukh Khan paid a glowing tribute to Andre Russell as the West Indies all-rounder decided to retire from IPL on Sunday, November 30. Shah Rukh also explained the new Power Coach role for Russell at KKR.

IND vs SA: Rohit Sharma breaks Shahid Afridi's world record for most ODI sixesRohit Sharma broke the world record for most sixes in ODI cricket during the first match against South Africa at Ranchi. He surpassed Shahid Afridi after smashing three sixes during his innings.

Virat Kohli-Rohit Sharma Jodi India's most capped as records tumble in Ranchi ODIVirat Kohli and Rohit Sharma became the most-capped pairing for India in international cricket, going past the record set by Sachin Tendulkar and Rahul Dravid. Kohli also went past Jacques Kallis in the most runs list in India vs South Africa ODIs.

SMAT: India outcasts Ishan Kishan, Abhimanyu Easwaran slam breathtaking centuriesIshan Kishan and Abhimanyu Easwaran both scored centuries in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy 2025–26. While Kishan's innings helped Jharkhand secure a convincing win, Easwaran's valiant knock went in vain for Bengal.

South Africa Elects to Bowl in Ranchi ODI; KL Rahul Leads India as Rohit, Kohli ReturnIn this sports update, India Today's Aishwarya Paliwal and Sports Editor Nikhil Naz discuss the 1st ODI between India and South Africa in Ranchi. South Africa has won the toss and elected to bowl first, a decision Nikhil attributes to the 'dew' factor expected later in the evening. Nikhil notes that it is 'time now to get done with tosses in India' given the team's poor record with the coin. The match highlights the return of stalwarts Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, who are 'determined to be playing' the 2027 World Cup. With KL Rahul leading the side, the focus remains on the veteran duo's form as they prepare for the future. Nikhil adds that despite losing the toss, fans will enjoy seeing 'Both Rohit and Virat come out to bat' soon.

IND vs SA: India opt for Ruturaj instead of Pant, Bavuma misses Ranchi ODIIndia have handed a return for Ruturaj Gaikwad into the ODI team ahead of Rishabh Pant in the match in Ranchi against South Africa on Sunday, November 30. The Proteas will be without the services of Temba Bavuma.

IPL 2026: Released by KKR, Andre Russell retires from IPL, flaunts loyaltyWest Indies all-rounder Andre Russell has announced that he has retired from IPL after 14 seasons. Russell will join KKR's backroom staff as their new power coach for the upcoming season.

IPL 2026: Released by KKR, Andre Russell retires from IPL, flaunts loyaltyWest Indies all-rounder Andre Russell has announced that he has retired from IPL after 14 seasons. Russell will join KKR's backroom staff as their new power coach for the upcoming season.

Wanted DC return in WPL 2026: Shikha Pandey after record 2.4 crore UPW moveIndia pacer Shikha Pandey admitted that she was hoping to be repurchased by the Delhi Capitals during the WPL 2026 auction. Shikha played three seasons for DC before being not retained by the franchise.

Is Ruturaj, Sanju opening pair viable for CSK? R Ashwin gives his takeFormer India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin shared his views on Ruturaj Gaikwad and Sanju Samson opening combination for CSK in IPL 2026. He mentioned that Ayush Mhatre and Urvil Patel are also making a strong case for themselves to be in the opening slot.

Ro-Ko mentality: Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli reveal newfound zeal for ODIsRohit Sharma and Virat Kohli revealed their newfound zeal for ODIs as both men get ready for the series against South Africa. Rohit and Kohli only play ODIs for India and are aiming to keep themselves in contention for the World Cup in 2027.

1st ODI Live: Harshit removes Brevis to dent South Africa's fightbackIndia (IND) vs South Africa (SA) 1st ODI Live Score and Updates: Harshit Rana has snapped 3 wickets in this match, and the latest being the big wicket of Dewald Brevis. South Africa got some big hopes with Brevis's attacking play, but now it is Jansen who needs to bring the same show alongside Breetzke.

Abhishek Sharma smashes 12-ball fifty in SMAT, emulates mentor Yuvraj SinghIndia's opening batter Abhishek Sharma entered the record books with a 12-ball half century for Punjab in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy 2025-26. He went on to score a 32-ball century and got involved in a massive partnership with Prabhsimran Singh for the first wicket.

2 roads, 1 destination: Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli and the art of ODI dominanceOne bat carves up powerplays, the other sculpts chases. One speaks in sixes, the other in singles. In ODI cricket's evolving landscape, Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli prove that greatness can arrive by different paths but land at the same destination.

Watch: Lionel Messi involved in ugly spat during Inter Miami's East final winLionel Messi was involved in an ugly spat during Inter Miami's dominant win over New York City FC during the Eastern Conference Final of the MLS on Saturday, November 29.

When Paddy Upton revealed a surprising insecure side of Gautam GambhirGautam Gambhir's unsettled Guwahati press conference brought Paddy Upton's old observations about his insecurities back into focus. At a time when India is searching for direction, those inner battles reveal a leader shaped by intensity, not fragility.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
